data.title: The Vincent Price Art Museum Foundation is excited and honored to announce the gathering of an amazing and talented group of community...
data.meta_description:
52 likes, 0 comments - vpam_arts on November 5, 2021: "The Vincent Price Art Museum Foundation is excited and honored to announce the gathering of an amazing and talented group of community artists who have come together to support VPAM through a silent art auction launching next month. 

Enjoy this little sneak peek of one of the pieces available, “Psychic Grotto” in chromatic clay, 2017, courtesy of Anna Sew Hoy and Eve Fowler.

About the artist: Anna Sew Hoy

Anna Sew Hoy was born in Auckland, New Zealand, and currently lives and works in Los Angeles. In 2019 Sew Hoy was appointed to the faculty at the UCLA School of Arts as Assistant Professor and Ceramics Area Head. 

“Solo presentations of Sew Hoy’s work have been mounted at the Aspen Art Museum, CO; the MOCA Storefront, Los Angeles; the Hammer Museum, Los Angeles; Koenig & Clinton, New York; LAXART; Various Small Fires, Los Angeles; the San Jose Museum of Art; and the California Biennial 2008 at the Orange County Museum of Art. Her work is in the collections of the Hammer Museum, the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, and the Museum of Contemporary Art in San Diego.” http://annasewhoy.info/

Presented by the Vincent Price Art Museum Foundation, the Art á la Carte auction will run from November 22 – December 11 and will benefit the Vincent Price Art Museum. 

DM for more info. 

#auctionpiece #auction #ArtalaCarte #MyCommunityMyMuseum #VPAM #AnneSewHoy #UCLASchoolofarts #architecture #PsychicGrotto #chromaticclay #ritual #repose #LAart #sculpture #LAauction".
